DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text that represents the Affymetrix probeset identifier.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An American company that manufactures DNA microarrays for the analysis of biological systems at the cell, protein, and gene level._General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest._A group of things of the same kind that belong together and are so used.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An American company that manufactures DNA microarrays for the analysis of biological systems at the cell, protein, and gene level.

Concepts.definition: An American company that manufactures DNA microarrays for the analysis of biological systems at the cell, protein, and gene level.

Property.preferredDefinition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.:A group of things of the same kind that belong together and are so used.

Concepts.definition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.
A group of things of the same kind that belong together and are so used.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A protein or RNA whose structure is represented in and determined by genomic sequences.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support CTD2 activity per request by S.Jagu. mc 10/28/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify the probeset identifier.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
